intro: Centunculus minimus var. simplex, commonly known as the small centunculus, is a diminutive flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, arid environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found growing in crevices or on slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
